column5: ä»¶ (jiÃ n)This measure word is used for items, events, or occurrences that are considered as separate and distinct entities, such as clothes, matters, or affairs.å— (kuÃ i)This measure word is used for objects or items that are considered as a whole or a unit, such as pieces of furniture, cakes, or other solid objects.For example, you would use ä»¶ (jiÃ n) for matters, affairs, or events, while you would use å— (kuÃ i) for solid objects or items.
